DataElement.preferredName: MRI Ultrasound Fusion Guided Biopsy Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: MRI Ultrasound Fusion Guided Biopsy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method for targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method for targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image.

Concepts.definition: A method for targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released as part of the 3Q2015 draft content review.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.: A device designed to help direct the passage of another object.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.
A device designed to help direct the passage of another object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.: High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
